page.title: 13CHURCH ACTIVITIES IN BURWELL
page.content: The Church holds a{Christingle}every year.This is a service when people take money and get an orange and a candle with which to walk round the Church.The orange represents the world and the candle represents the light of Christ.They also have nuts on it for the seasons of the world.The idea is to help the{Church of England {Children's}Society.It raises Â£400_Â£500 a year.The Vicar organises it and it started approx in 1977. There is also a{Fete}every year to help repair the Church,provide food for the people's communion and for the different charity chosen each year. A committee is in charge of the Fete.There is also a{Sponsored Walk for the Church and{Christian {Aid}.About 40_120 people do the trip around the Parish Boundaries.They raise about Â£500.
